sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: You're watching Euronews Now with me, Takumbo Silako.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Let's start by looking at our top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: There have been violent clashes in Belgium, Austria and the Netherlands as several EU states reintroduced COVID restrictions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: A Christmas parade in the US state of Wisconsin ends in tragedy after a car plows into the crowd.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And the US state of Wisconsin ends in tragedy after a car plows into the crowd.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And Chinese tennis star Peng Shuai holds a video call with Olympic officials, but supporters say they want more evidence that she's safe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Austria is the latest country to enter in a fourth lockdown since the start of the pandemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The country's low vaccination rate has led to record after record in the number of infections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Vienna will make vaccinations mandatory in 2022.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The new restrictions will remain in place until the 13th of December at the latest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The Christmas period will be interrupted for several weeks and many Austrians used its last day of normality.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Many are just resigned, but for business owners it's a big hit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We're not in a good mood.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We had these six weeks ready in our plans.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The work here has been great fun so far.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Nobody thought there would be a lockdown for the Christmas markets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It's a bit sad for us and shocking, so we're not happy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: In several cities, including Salzburg and Linz, protesters gathered to reject a new lockdown of the vaccination decree.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: In Brussels, peaceful protests against the new Covid rules, decided by the government, soon turned to violent clashes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Police used tear gas to restore order.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Belgium will make teleworking mandatory most of the week and will broaden the use of the face masks after the number of new COVID cases has reached worrying levels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The Czech Republic will also apply stricter rules, especially with the unvaccinated population.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Negative coronavirus tests will not be recognized as COVID certificate to go to a hairdresser or a restaurant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Companies must also test unvaccinated workers on a weekly basis from Monday. Germany had already imposed stricter measures, closures of some public places, more control over the non-vaccinated. Now the German authorities are debating, due to the low inoculation rate, whether to make the vaccine mandatory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Austrian teachers and parents are quite confused about the new hard lockdown measures which come into effect today in Austria.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: While most non-essential shops remain closed, as well as theatres, bars and restaurants, schools remain open.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But the Austrian government urges parents to keep their children at home and safe, because school children have among the highest seven-day incidence rates in Austria.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But parents are not just worried about their children's education, but also about the mandatory vaccination which has been introduced in Austria, or will be introduced before 1st of February.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A lot of protesters have hit the streets on Saturday in Vienna between 40 and 100,000, but also yesterday on Sunday in Linz, there were thousands of protesters and many of them against a mandatory vaccine especially for the children but it is likely that the European Medicines Agency will approve for example the pfizer and biotech vaccine also for children starting age five so it is possible that the mandatory vaccine will apply also to them in Austria. Johannes Blechberger, Euronews, Milstädtersee, Austria.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Well, let's get a little more now on those protests in the Netherlands

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: over the country's re-imposition of COVID-19 rules and restrictions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Our reporter Fernand van Tetz is in Amsterdam for us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Fernand, good to see you there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: There's been lots of violence, of course, over the weekend in several towns, The Hague and Rotterdam, whose mayor described the events as an orgy of violence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Why are so many people so angry?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: So this is the first full weekend of this partial lockdown measures coming into force.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: That means bars and restaurants have to close at 8 p.m.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: And also that sports events are not allowed to have any spectators. So in Rotterdam, for example, it seems that supporters of the football club Feyenoord were a big player in those protests.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: And that has also coincided with the announcement last week that there will be no fireworks allowed to be set off on New Year's Eve. Now, that is a huge tradition here in the Netherlands.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: But the government has said due to the rising number of COVID cases, they don't want the additional pressure on hospitals that any victims could cause. So those two things really coinciding with basically mostly peaceful protests escalating, with protesters then using those heavy fireworks, which are going to be banned against the police.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: So, Philem, what's been the government's response to this?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Are they going to increase their efforts to try and convince people that these restrictions and rules are the right way to do things, or are they just determined to coerce people, as it were, or some people are claiming?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: So the Justice Minister has been very clear that this is criminal behaviour that has nothing to do with demonstrating, and over 100 people have been arrested over the past few days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: And if you look at the rhetoric the government has been employing, it's very much a focus on the people that are not vaccinated should get a shot in order to protect everybody. And one of the ways they're trying to increase pressure is by introducing 2G measures, which means only those people that are vaccinated or recently recovered can partake in public life. A legislative amendment is actually being introduced to that effect today. And although the slim majority of the Dutch population has been polled and says it is supportive of those measures, it's unclear if that will actually get through the House. Now, meanwhile, cases here continue to rise close to 20,000 defectors a day and the number of people in intensive care units still rising.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: And so actually we're hearing talk now of more serious measures being imposed, perhaps a longer lockdown, including the closure of schools.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: And that could last all through the winter. At least five people are dead and more than 40 injured after a car ploughed into a Christmas

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: parade in the US state of Wisconsin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The incident took place in the town of Waukesha on Sunday afternoon as crowds watched the annual holiday event. Police Chief Dan Thompson told reporters that a person of interest was in custody and a car has been recovered.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: An officer did discharge his weapon at the suspect vehicle to try to stop the vehicle.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: No bystanders were injured as a result of the weapon discharge.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The officer involved has been with the department for six and a half years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Thompson also said there are no other threats, but schools in the area will be closed on Monday. The Chinese tennis star Peng Shui has told the International Olympic Committee she's

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: safe and well. Chinese tennis star Peng Shui has told the International Olympic Committee she's safe and well, nearly three weeks after she made sexual assault allegations against a senior Chinese minister, then disappeared from public view.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The IOC's President Thomas Bach said they spoke on Sunday, and Peng told him she was at home in Beijing but wanted her privacy respected for the moment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Chinese state media has released several videos of the tennis star appearing at a tournament in the country's capital and at a restaurant in the city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But her supporters abroad, including the Women's Tennis Association, had said they feared she was being coerced.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Peng had alleged she was forced into sexual relations with the former Chinese vice premier Zhang Gaoli, but her post was removed from social media within minutes.

sentences.sentence: While fighting has stopped in most of Syria, the province of Idlib is still under heavy shelling by Russian and Syrian forces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But for residents, especially children, unexploded bombs that litter the area can pose as great a threat as the ongoing attacks. Euronews reporters Yusuf Garibi and Heba Shehadeh sent us this report from the town of Tawama.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: An unexploded bomb changed the life of the Rahal family.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The kids were playing with it when it suddenly started emitting smoke.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Mahmoud was not home when the explosion happened, but he got the call to head towards the hospital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: I went to the hospital and no one told me anything. They said nothing happened to your kids, don't be scared and then… Reem flew for 10 meters and I flew for 5.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Mariam and Reem went through 16 operations to save their lives, while their brothers, Mustafa, aged 12, and Yassine, 2, died.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Then I saw them. They were put in two boxes. I asked, are those my children? They said, yes. I can't go on anymore.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Then I called you.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: I called dad.

sentences.sentence: There is almost no area in northwest Syria clear of unexploded ordnance.

sentences.sentence: They scan the area for explosives that can remain undiscovered for years waiting to be activated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: These things make our work more complicated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Today we clear a space, then the regime bombs it again.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: So after we cleanse the area, we come back again and find it contaminated again by that bombing." So far, the ammunition removal teams have got rid of around 22,766 pieces of ammunition of several kinds, mostly in clusters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: As they wait for an end to this seemingly endless war, civilians have no options but to keep an eye on the sky and another on the ground.

sentences.sentence: Ethiopian demonstrators protested outside the US Embassy in London to stop what they say is American support for the Tigray People's Liberation Front, a rebel group embroiled in a gruelling year-long war with Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed's government forces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: The London demonstration was one of many across the world, including one in Washington DC.

sentences.sentence: Paris' main street was brought to life on Sunday as its Christmas lights were switched on.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The world-famous boulevard was packed with people who came to watch the event.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It doesn't need to be thrown away, we can still fix it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Phrases like these are often heard in this café in Copenhagen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Six years ago, the café's manager began specialising in events where customers can bring in damaged electrical devices and have them repaired free of charge.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: We have to take care of the planet.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We can't afford to live like we used to live, so we have to make a movement about not throwing things out when it's still working. However, it's not always that easy. Some devices are built in a way that makes them very difficult to open and repair. Sometimes it's even impossible to bring them back to life.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Whether it's glue in the product that makes it very difficult to take out a part and replace it, whether it's glue in the product that makes it very difficult to take out a part and replace it, whether it's the use of proprietary tools, meaning you need to have specific tools that are linked to the manufacturer to open a product, or whether it's the fact that spare parts or repair information are very difficult to access. The Dane is campaigning for a new policy to be introduced throughout the European Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: This set of guidelines will rate electrical devices on a scale of 0 to 10, according to their repairability.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Such an index has already been in place in France since the beginning of the year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Just days after the climate negotiations at the COP26 summit came to a close, Ukraine's president announced an ambitious reforestation project.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: Here, in the north of the country, workers are putting tree seedlings into the ground in an attempt to counteract the effects of climate change.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Europe declared plans to plant 3 billion trees in 10 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The whole of Europe planned 3 billion in 10 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: But our plan is planting 1 billion in 3 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: But some scientists question how realistic this ambition is.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: They must plant 10 trees a second or 200 seedlings in a second.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: So this is not possible technically.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: This is absolutely unrealistic in terms of space and timing planned by the president.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Experts say that approximately 16% of Ukraine's territory is covered by forest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: But 3-4% more is needed to challenge climate change.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Manchester United's embattled manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer has been fired after a string of poor results left the club in seventh place in the Premier League.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The club said in a statement that Solskjaer would always be a legend and that it was with regret that management had reached what they called a difficult decision.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It follows a run of poor form, including a 5-0 thrashing by regional rivals Liverpool last month and a 4-1 defeat by relative Minnows Watford on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: last month, and a 4-1 defeat by relative Minos Watford on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Speculation now turns to his successor, with the former Real Madrid manager Zinedine Zidane an early favourite for the role.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Frenchman is currently out of work, but he could be the right fit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: An appointment by United would reunite him with the Portuguese international star Cristiano Ronaldo.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: England's David Beckham and France's World Cup winner Marcel Desailly were among the stars to join the celebrations in Doha on Sunday to remind football fans they've got just one year to wait for the Qatar World Cup to begin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Are you ready now?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A giant countdown clock was unveiled during the ceremony, also attended by FIFA president Gianni Infantino.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The tournament planning has been overshadowed by reports of large numbers of deaths during the construction of the eighth stadia that will host the games, unproven claims of bribes being given during the awarding of the games and concerns over high temperatures, which mean the tournament will now take place in the middle of the European football season.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Alexander Zverev is the 2021 ATP Finals champion

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: after defeating Daniel Medvedev in straight set 6-4-6-4 in Turin, Italy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A day after beating world number one Novak Djokovic in the semis, Zverev showed no signs of fatigue, putting in a dominant performance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Zverev controlled the tempo from the outset, imposing a strong service game.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Medvedev tried to stay in the game, but his service was lacking and the world number three served out the victory with an ace. The title rounds off quite a year for Zverev, who also won a gold at the Tokyo Olympics and recorded his 59th victory on tour.
